> Let's NOT create a giant file that contains all of the skeletons.
> 
> Idea is to move all new pieces to `src/pages` directory. And `src/pages/<module>/components/` directory would contain components associated to that module.
>

Example: https://github.com/pupilfirst/pupilfirst/blob/master/app/frontend/shared/components/SkeletonLoading.res

activity.text:
@sainak can we add an enum `Mobility status` to the patient? Options are 
- Bed bound (any person who cannot get up from bed without someone's help)
- Home bound ( any person who is not bed bound but cannot get out of home without someone's help)
- Independently mobile with illness (any person who is not bed bound or home bound with illness)
- Independently mobile and active without illness

The descriptive keys can be part of the FE

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8847
activity.text:
@aravindm4 lets just add the tag, lets not make the removal automatic. 

```yml
name: Notify Core Team on Non-Core Questions

on:
  issue_comment:
    types: [created]

jobs:
  notify_core_team:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check if commenter is non-core member
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const coreMembers = ['coreMember1', 'coreMember2']; // Define core members
            const commenter = context.payload.comment.user.login;
            if (!coreMembers.includes(commenter)) {
              return commenter; // Proceed if not core member
            }

      - name: Check if comment is a question
        id: check_question
        run: |
          echo "${{ github.event.comment.body }}" | grep -Eq "(\?|what|how|why|when|who)"
        
      - name: Notify core team
        if: ${{ steps.check_question.outcome == 'success' }}
        run: |
          curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' --data '{"text":"A non-core member posted a question: https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}/issues/${{ github.event.issue.number }}"}' ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}

      - name: Add question label (optional)
        if: ${{ steps.check_question.outcome == 'success' }}
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            await github.issues.addLabels({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.payload.issue.number,
              labels: ['question'],
            });

```

Something like this with options for questions and core configurable via actions env

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7798
activity.text:
I am strongly against adding more of these ids, a facility level unique ID has absolutely no value when you have a patient identifier ü§∑üèª, these are mostly remanence from a non tech era. 

Also this assumes care is used in parallel with another HMIS system, we should work towards a future where its just care and prioritise features for it. 

Ideally I will let users print a QR/barcode; at every location we will have a scanner that directly scans these so that user doesn't have to search.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7798
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @gigincg @aparnacoronasafe 
Instead of us storing these ID, can't the hospital store our ID into the system? 

I think we should re-think storing these numbers in the system going forward. 

- Going forward OP number will be unique per doctor per day. 
- IP number will be auto incremented per facility where the facility can pick a starting point. 

I am leaning towards allowing users to print and store a barcode for each patient file, this will let them easily find out the patient in the system.

This should ideally address the following. 
- In case of an OP consult the doctor that the nurse is working with should be smart filled initially
- In case of IP the treating doctor should be the default choice 
- In case if its a referral, that doctor should come in as default choice
